verses.verse: And when I came<WG2064> to you, brethren,<WG80> I did not come<WG2064> with superiority<WG5247> of speech<WG3056> or<WG2228> of wisdom,<WG4678> proclaiming<WG2605> to you the testimony<WG3142> of God.<WG2316>
For I determined<WG2919> to know<WG3609> nothing<WG3756> <WG5100> among<WG1722> you except<WG1508> Jesus<WG2424> Christ,<WG5547> and Him crucified.<WG4717>
And I was with you in weakness<WG769> and in fear<WG5401> and in much<WG4183> trembling.<WG5156>
And my message<WG3056> and my preaching<WG2782> were not in persuasive<WG3981> words<WG3056> of wisdom,<WG4678> but in demonstration<WG585> of the Spirit<WG4151> and of power,<WG1411>
that your faith<WG4102> should not rest<WG1510> on the wisdom<WG4678> of men,<WG444> but on the power<WG1411> of God.<WG2316>

Yet<WG1161> we do speak<WG2980> wisdom<WG4678> among<WG1722> those<WG3588> who are mature;<WG5046> a wisdom,<WG4678> however,<WG1161> not of this<WG3778> age,<WG165> nor<WG3761> of the rulers<WG758> of this<WG3778> age,<WG165> who are passing<WG2673> away;<WG2673>
but we speak<WG2980> God<WG2316>'s wisdom<WG4678> in a mystery,<WG3466> the hidden<WG613> [wisdom,] which<WG3739> God predestined<WG4309> before<WG4253> the ages<WG165> to our glory;<WG1391>

[the wisdom] which<WG3739> none<WG3762> of the rulers<WG758> of this<WG3778> age<WG165> has understood;<WG1097> for if<WG1487> they had understood<WG1097> it, they would not have crucified<WG4717> the Lord<WG2962> of glory;<WG1391>

but just<WG2531> as it is written,<WG1125> "Things which<WG3739> eye<WG3788> has not seen<WG3708> and ear<WG3775> has not heard,<WG191> And [which] have not entered<WG305> the heart<WG2588> of man,<WG444> All<WG3745> that God<WG2316> has prepared<WG2090> for those<WG3588> who love<WG25> Him."
For to us God<WG2316> revealed<WG601> [them] through<WG1223> the Spirit;<WG4151> for the Spirit<WG4151> searches<WG2045> all<WG3956> things,<WG3956> even<WG2532> the depths<WG899> of God.<WG2316>

For who<WG5101> among men<WG444> knows<WG3609> the [thoughts] of a man<WG444> except<WG1508> the spirit<WG4151> of the man,<WG444> which is in him? Even<WG2532> so<WG3779> the [thoughts] of God<WG2316> no<WG3762> one<WG3762> knows<WG1097> except<WG1508> the Spirit<WG4151> of God.<WG2316>

Now<WG1161> we have received,<WG2983> not the spirit<WG4151> of the world,<WG2889> but the Spirit<WG4151> who<WG3588> is from God,<WG2316> that we might know<WG3609> the things<WG5483> freely<WG5483> given<WG5483> to us by God,<WG2316>

which<WG3739> things we also<WG2532> speak,<WG2980> not in words<WG3056> taught<WG1318> by human<WG442> wisdom,<WG4678> but in those taught<WG1318> by the Spirit,<WG4151> combining<WG4793> spiritual<WG4152> [thoughts] with spiritual<WG4152> [words.]

But a natural<WG5591> man<WG444> does not accept<WG1209> the things of the Spirit<WG4151> of God;<WG2316> for they are foolishness<WG3472> to him, and he cannot<WG1410> <WG3756> understand<WG1097> them, because<WG3754> they are spiritually<WG4153> appraised.<WG350>
But he who is spiritual<WG4152> appraises<WG350> all<WG3956> things,<WG3956> yet<WG1161> he himself<WG846> is appraised<WG350> by no<WG3762> man.<WG3762>
For who<WG5101> has known<WG1097> the mind<WG3563> of the Lord,<WG2962> that he should instruct<WG4822> Him? But we have<WG2192> the mind<WG3563> of Christ.<WG5547>
